As an AI language model, I cannot provide medical advice, but I can suggest that before taking any supplements, distance runners should consult with a qualified healthcare professional or sports dietitian to determine if the supplement is necessary and safe for their individual needs.

That said, some supplements that may be beneficial for distance runners include:

1. Creatine: Creatine has been shown to improve strength and endurance performance in some studies.

2. Beta-alanine: Beta-alanine is an amino acid that may help improve endurance performance by buffering lactic acid.

3. Caffeine: Caffeine is a well-researched supplement that has been shown to improve endurance performance, alertness, and focus.

4. Iron: Endurance runners may be at risk of iron deficiency, which can lead to fatigue and decreased performance. Iron supplements may be necessary for runners who are deficient.

5. Vitamin D: Vitamin D deficiency may be common among athletes, and supplementation can improve bone health and overall performance.

Again, it is essential to consult with a qualified healthcare professional or sports dietitian before taking any supplements, as some may have adverse effects or interact with medications. A balanced diet and proper hydration are the most critical factors for distance running performance.
